intro: Chaetogastra galipensis, commonly known as the Galipensian thornplant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and hairy leaves, with small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
